label: 紫鑛
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: A resinous substance secreted by the Laccifer lacca-a scale-shaped insect native to South Asia that becomes incrusted on branches. Producing a red dye popularly used in India, lac dye saturated in cotton was imported in small quantities to Japan and treasured for its medicinal as well as coloring properties.
